title:
Asymptotic and stability analysis of kinetic models for opinion
  formation on networks: an Allen-Cahn approach
authors: M. Burger, N. Loy, A. Rossi
abstract:
We present the analysis of the stationary equilibria and their stability in
case of an opinion formation process in presence of binary opposite opinions
evolving according to majority-like rules on social networks. The starting
point is a kinetic Boltzmann-type model derived from microscopic interactions
rules for the opinion exchange among individuals holding a certain degree of
connectivity. The key idea is to derive from the kinetic model an Allen-Cahn
type equation for the fraction of individuals holding one of the two opinions.
The latter can be studied by means of a linear stability analysis and by
exploiting integral operator analysis. While this is true for ternary
interactions, for binary interactions the derived equation of interest is a
linear scattering equation, that can be studied by means of General Relative
Entropy tools and integral operators.
